title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earthâ€™s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
Email
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     Steam
  




Welcome to my website!
I am Ryan Deng, a first year PhD student in the Biology program at Case Western Reserve University, but I transferred to the Biochemistry program under the BSTP, School of Medicine, starting next Spring.
My research interest focus on the signal transduction pathway on the molecular level inside or between cells. My current lab work examines how one anchor protein affects the distribution of a cholinergic neuron receptor in Drosophila brain, which plays a part in the circus responsible for decision-making.
Besides research, I had been worked closely with various analytical assays commonly used in the pharmaceutical industry, ranging from physiochemical to cell biological. Two antibody drug development projects I participated have been approved for IND.
Before graduate school, I completed my BS degree in cell and molecular biology at the University of British Columbia in Canada. I lived in Vancouver for more than five years to complete my undergrad degree with co-op program.
Aside from academic, I am passionate about movie evaluation, music, and ice-skating.


Education
PhD: Biology - CWRU Faculty of Science, 2023 - present
BS: Cell and Molecular Biology - University of British Columbia, 2016 - 2021


Work Experience
Analytical Scientist 09/2021-09/2022 - WuXiBiologics, Shanghai, China

Provided technical support for biologic drug analysis experiments such as iCIEF, SDS CE, SEC, and IEX . And wrote analysis reports for in-process and lotprocess and lot-release products from other departments.release products from other departments.
Lead analytical team to conduct biologic drug development projects during CMC stage
